top_comments.comment: My tip:  sleep in your own guest room to see how it actually works…🤞
When you impress the pants off your guests, that's where the bathrobes come in handy! ☺️
I had a guest robe in the bathroom on back of door and my guest took it home hahaha i didn't have the heart to say anything lol
If your guest came on an airplane, they didn't forget the shampoo, it got confiscated at security.

This makes my day!  I've just spent the last week revitalizing the forbidden zone that was my teenager's cave.  He left town to go to College in September.  I converted the room into a Guest Room (for him too of course).  According to your tips, I did very well!  The big edit, deep cleaning, the pristine linens, two options for pillows, extra blanket, cupboard space, happy pegs/hooks, freshly cleaned housecoat, night table and easy lighting, nice towels, and a little basket ... BUT here are two things that I want 'rock star' points for!  1) I upholstered a bench that can be easily moved around and improvised as a bench, coffee table or laptop desk or for snacking (and a tray for that) and 2) An empty storage basket/box with a lid that the Guests can use to contain their valuables.  And VOILA, my teenager just arrived for the weekend a few hours ago ... for a 'test run'!  Thank you, Lisa!  Your timing for this Guest Room Vid just adds to the glory!

comments_since_last_sample.body: Amazing tips, thanks Lisa.

My guest room is very small and not luxurious but complete. There's a small bureau with a bookcase on top, a small closet. The sheets don't match but they're 300 thread count. There's task lighting, a down comforter, a comfortable rug.
My 81 year old dad's been living in it for two months now and seems happy to spend the rest of his says there, so I have to conclude it's inviting. (Supposedly it was to bea a temporary stay but he doesn't want to leave.)
How about a small vase of fresh flowers also a nightlight in case they get up at night
Edit: take crap to Goodwill
“Hooks are your honey, baby!”  LOL
When you impress the pants off your guests, that's where the bathrobes come in handy! ☺️

I add more PLUGS!  I put a couple of power strips (one hidden by the bed and one by the dresser) because it seems there are never enough, especially with all our devices we use now.  I also put an over-the-closet-door framed full length MIRROR which is near the power strip by the dresser.  I'm constantly staying in hotels obviously designed by a man and NOT Lisa...the mirror in the room (where I style my hair while the shower is being used and adding humidity to the bathroom mirror area) is NEVER near the outlet I need for my styling tools.
Hey Lisa🎉🙋‍♀️ sweet fun important ideas for yr guest room. Awesome🥳
If your guest came on an airplane, they didn't forget the shampoo, it got confiscated at security.

I don't have a guest room. I have a small craft room and a very small budget. Do have a thick air mattress and some nice sheets. I'm slowly trying to combine these two. Have down sized and miss the extra space. But I'm working on it as I do have company coming. Love your videos and your enthusiasm. Thanks.

I love, love, LOVE this one! My new daughter-in-law will be visiting with my son this holiday season and I really want her to feel welcome. As you went down your list, I thought, yup, that would make me feel welcome but I hadn't thought of them especially the BASKET!  Now I'm really excited for the visit instead of nervous. I can't wait!
Great tips
Pro tip on the linen colour, thanks

Great suggestions Lisa!  My recent guests really appreciated the hooks for jackets and purses. I added a folding luggage rack and they loved that too. I hadn’t thought about robes but I think I’ll add that next. No one wants to pack a nice fluffy robe.
My tip:  sleep in your own guest room to see how it actually works…🤞

This makes my day!  I've just spent the last week revitalizing the forbidden zone that was my teenager's cave.  He left town to go to College in September. And VOILA, my teenager just arrived for the weekend a few hours ago ... for a 'test run'!  Thank you, Lisa!  Your timing for this Guest Room Vid just adds to the glory!
Great suggestions...will you do a video on how to choose windows for your house. Would love to see more kitchen videos to.
Great tips for nightly rentals as well.
